messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Working Teens
messages.msgSnippet: A Guide for Working Teens http://www.cdc.gov/niosh/99-14111.html Gives general overview of some laws for working teens.  Plus lists resources from each state
messages.messageBody:
A Guide for Working Teens
http://www.cdc.gov/niosh/99-14111.html

Gives general overview of some laws for working teens. Plus lists resources
from each state where you should be able to get details of specifics for
your state.

Robyn in St. Charles, MO
(mom to Taylor - 12)

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Working Teens
messages.msgSnippet: Kelly Lovejoy s recommendation is to set up a poop-scooping service and make good money that way, cleaning dog poo out of people s back yards. Sandra
messages.messageBody:
Kelly Lovejoy's recommendation is to set up a poop-scooping service
and make good money that way, cleaning dog poo out of people's back
yards.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Working Teens
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Seth has mentioned wanting to get a job somewhere (various places) and he will be 13 in July - how would a 13 year old go about getting a job,
messages.messageBody:
-=-Seth has mentioned wanting to get a job somewhere (various places)
and he
will be 13 in July - how would a 13 year old go about getting a job,
legality-wise?-=-

Depends on the state, but most places you pretty much have to be 15
or 16.

Kirby was offered the job because he had volunteered to help, lots,
at the shop where he was hanging out.
Another friend of his who was there and said he was NEVER going to
work for free ended up going years without having a job. Kirby, who
was working because the work needed to be done and he was capable and
present, has worked now for seven years.

Had Kirby asked for a job, I don't think he would have gotten one.

Marty was offered his first job, too. He was 15. Being out and
about, being helpful, being interested in things, is what got them
opportunities, and sometimes volunteer opportunities, but earning
people's trust and confidence, and gaining experience, are important.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Working Teens
messages.msgSnippet: I found this on Yahoo.  I know he s almost 13 but this page had th best answer. http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20070601174224AAlDy9p Maybe, if he
messages.messageBody:
I found this on Yahoo. I know he's almost 13 but this page had th best
answer.

http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20070601174224AAlDy9p

Maybe, if he is friends with people at the gaming shop or other place, they
might have him come in for a few hours here and there to help out.

Erica

messages.subject: Working Teens
messages.msgSnippet: ~~~ Kirby started working at a gaming shop when he was 14, but had been doing role playing games and collectible card games before that (and during, and after)
messages.messageBody:
~~~ Kirby started working at a gaming shop when he was 14, but had been
doing role playing games and collectible card games before that (and
during, and after) and lots of their current friends came from those
days.~~~



Seth has mentioned wanting to get a job somewhere (various places) and he
will be 13 in July - how would a 13 year old go about getting a job,
legality-wise?



With Utmost Gratitude,
Christy Putnam
Funschooling Mom to Seth (12) and Aden (2)
Funloving Wife to Chet (7/4/04)

My Blog <http://blog.360.yahoo.com/blog-T5EDDQohfrQSzRSxKyT.uBV3VXEhgoA5> -
Our Life
Our Yahoo <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/FYI-OKC/> Group: FYI-OKC
Watch this clip, then <http://www.whyarewepoisoningourchildren.com/> ask me
about alternatives!

One of the hardest things about mindful parenting is
letting go of the perceived need to live by
the standards of other people. ~ adapted from Melissa Gray
